item.title: World leaders hail Biden’s ‘brave’ decision to end his 2024 campaign
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Anika Seth
item.description: Biden, who served on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee before ascending to higher office, nurtured relationships with many world leaders over decades.

item.title: See how Social Security retirement benefits stack up globally
item.dc:creator: Julie Weil
item.description: A look at how the U.S. public pension system stacks up to more than 100 others, in five charts.

item.title: Netanyahu comes to Washington as Biden withdraws from presidential race
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, John Hudson
item.description: The shifting political winds in Washington could empower Netanyahu, analysts said, at a crucial time in Gaza cease-fire and hostage-release negotiations.

item.title: Israel intercepts missile from Yemen after airstrikes on Houthi port
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Annabelle Timsit, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Israeli forces said the missile was launched from Yemen a day after Israel struck a Houthi-controlled port there and two days after a rare Houthi attack in Tel Aviv.

item.title: ‘Magical’ self-portrait was hidden for decades — until the canvas was flipped
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: The self-portrait by Norman Cornish, a celebrated 20th-century British artist, was found when a conservator removed a board at the back of another artwork.

item.title: Venezuela’s presidential election: How to run against an autocrat
item.dc:creator: Ana Herrero, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, trailing challenger Edmundo González in polls, has stepped up repression ahead of what he pledged would be a free and fair election.

item.title: Israel strikes Yemen port after Houthis claim drone attack in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Alon Rom, Steve Hendrix, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: Israel’s attack Saturday heralded a further expansion of the war in Gaza, and added a volatile new dynamic to what has become a building regional conflict.

item.title: Toll in Bangladesh protests tops 100 as Dhaka falls quiet under curfew
item.dc:creator: Azad Majumder, Rebecca Tan
item.description: Dhaka and several other Bangladeshi cities have been engulfed by protests in opposition to a new policy reserving a portion of government jobs for certain groups.

item.title: In this city, people say Russia must defeat Ukraine and the West at any cost
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: The Post visited Kirov, in western Russia, where residents say President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine is a fight for Russia’s survival against the U.S. and NATO.

item.title: Yemen’s Houthis claim drone strike near U.S. Embassy branch in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Kareem Fahim, Steve Hendrix, Kelsey Ables
item.description: One person was killed and at least five injured in the attack, which Israeli officials say probably came from Yemen.

item.title: What caused the Windows outages affecting flights, companies around the world
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff, Eva Dou, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: Microsoft said it was aware of an issue affecting Windows programs running cybersecurity technology from CrowdStrike. Here’s how flights, hospitals and services were affected.
